column4: I have gutsy and a Broadcom Corporation BCM4312  the restricted driver manager says that firmware for broadcom 43xxx is in use. iwconfig shows http://pastebin.ca/758030 but network manager wireless is all 'greyed out' and inaccessible. Why?
if you right click NM does it show that wireless is enabled?
sorry but u didnt answer my question
I have a window open that says 'network manager' at the top. do you mean the panel applet?
yes the panel applet, which is called nm-applet
I have a applet called 'Network monitor' I do not see a applet called network manager anywhere
nothing happened. Should i sudo? sam@sam-laptop:~$ nm-applet
do you have "Notification area" added to your panel?
ok so left click the nm-applet and see if you see any networks
so if you left click the nm-applet what do you see?
try rebooting, also is your SSID on broadcast?
its my suggestion, either you do or you don't
so you understand what happen, i don't think nm-applet was running, and when you ran it at the CLI it started it but couldn't find any networks. I have the same Broadcom card
